TopicTitle: Can I change the orbit visualisation.

Articles.Content:
An object in a circular orbit will, by default, show its orbit with a thin line in front of the object (the prediction of the future position) and a thick line projected backwards. See for instance this recently released KSP ver. 1.2 image:

Spoiler

I find it is confusing that the most immediate part of the projected path is the least visible.

Can I swap the orbit graph settings around to get the thick line parts as the most immediate future positions and the thinner ones the more distant future ones?

Yes.

Open your settings.cfg in the root of your KSP folder, and modify this line: 

ORBIT_FADE_DIRECTION_INV = True

By default it's False. That's a copy/paste from my file.

It may also be in the options but I don't have time to open the game right now
Thank you. I feel more calm now that my craft's orbit path line makes sense.
